description: Attested since 1882. From Medieval Latin graduandus, gerundive of graduō (“to graduate”).

entries.meaning: (Britain, Canada) A student who has completed the requirements for, but has not yet been awarded, a particular degree.
examples: In order to add jollity to the proceedings, said the dean, each graduand would find beneath his seat a little tub of bubbles, complete with mortar board cap.
